subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “pig”
: Possibly from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|-}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). {{zh-ref|Löffler (1966)}} considers {{cog|mro|tia||(wild) pig}} to be cognate. 
: ''{{w|Fangyan}}'' states that {{och-l|豭}} is a dialectal variant of {{och-l|豬}}, yet ''*kra'' was apparently older than ''*t(r)a'' and homophonic with {{och-l|麚|[[stag]]}}; so instead ''*t(r)a'' is possibly an early rural dialectal variant (from the sound changes ''*ʈa'' < ''*tra'' < ''*Cra'') of ''*kra'', which would have had a general meaning of "male animal". See {{zh-l|*豭}} for more.

; “{{q|Cantonese}} virginity”
: Referring to the similar-sounding word {{zh-l|處|tr=cyu2}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * This character may be considered taboo by Muslim groups in China, who will substitute {{zh-l|豬}} with {{zh-l|黑}}, {{zh-l|豬肉}} with {{zh-l|大肉}}, etc.
